fields.name: fees
fields.description: Fetches a paginated list of fees associated with this asset.

args.name: after
args.description: Forward pagination: Cursor (fee ID) to start retrieving fees after this point.

args.name: before
args.description: Backward pagination: Cursor (fee ID) to start retrieving fees before this point.

args.name: first
args.description: Foward pagination: Limit the result to the first **n** fees after the `after` cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Backward pagination: Limit the result to the last **n** fees before the `before` cursor.

args.name: sortOrder
args.description: Specify the sort order of fees based on their creation data, either ascending or descending.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: client
fields.description: Information about the wallet address of the Open Payments client that created the incoming payment.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date and time that the incoming payment was created.

fields.name: expiresAt
fields.description: Date and time that the incoming payment will expire. After this time, the incoming payment will not accept further payments made to it.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the incoming payment.

fields.name: incomingAmount
fields.description: The maximum amount that should be paid into the wallet address under this incoming payment.

fields.name: liquidity
fields.description: Current amount of liquidity available for this incoming payment.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Additional metadata associated with the incoming payment.

fields.name: receivedAmount
fields.description: The total amount that has been paid into the wallet address under this incoming payment.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State of the incoming payment.

fields.name: walletAddressId
fields.description: Unique identifier of the wallet address under which the incoming payment was created.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of incoming payment edges, containing incoming payment nodes and cursors for pagination.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Pagination information for the incoming payments.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for paginating through the incoming payments.

fields.name: node
fields.description: An incoming payment node in the list.

fields.name: payment
fields.description: The incoming payment object returned in the response.

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: The payment is completed automatically once the expected `incomingAmount` is received or manually via an API call.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The payment has expired before completion, and no further funds will be accepted.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The payment is pending when it is initially created and has not started processing.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING
enumValues.description: The payment is being processed after funds have started clearing into the account.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: The `JSONObject` scalar type represents JSON objects as specified by the [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf) standard.

fields.name: alg
fields.description: Cryptographic algorithm used with the key. The only allowed value is `EdDSA`.

fields.name: crv
fields.description: Cryptographic curve that the key pair is derived from. The only allowed value is `Ed25519`.

fields.name: kid
fields.description: Unique identifier for the key.

fields.name: kty
fields.description: Key type. The only allowed value is `OKP`.

fields.name: x
fields.description: Base64 url-encoded public key.

inputFields.name: alg
inputFields.description: Cryptographic algorithm used with the key. The only allowed value is `EdDSA`.

inputFields.description: Cryptographic curve that the key pair is derived from. The only allowed value is `Ed25519`.

inputFields.name: kid
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the key.

inputFields.name: kty
inputFields.description: Key type. The only allowed value is `OKP`.

inputFields.name: x
inputFields.description: Base64 url-encoded public key.

enumValues.name: OKP
enumValues.description: Octet Key Pair (OKP) key type.

enumValues.name: AlreadyPosted
enumValues.description: The transfer has already been posted.

enumValues.name: AlreadyVoided
enumValues.description: The transfer has already been voided.

enumValues.name: AmountZero
enumValues.description: The amount specified for the transfer is zero.

enumValues.name: InsufficientBalance
enumValues.description: Insufficient balance to complete the transfer.

enumValues.name: InvalidId
enumValues.description: The provided ID for the transfer is invalid.

enumValues.name: TransferExists
enumValues.description: A transfer with the same ID already exists.

enumValues.name: UnknownAsset
enumValues.description: The specified asset could not be found.

enumValues.name: UnknownIncomingPayment
enumValues.description: The specified incoming payment could not be found.

enumValues.name: UnknownPayment
enumValues.description: The specified payment could not be found.

enumValues.name: UnknownPeer
enumValues.description: The specified peer could not be found.

enumValues.name: UnknownTransfer
enumValues.description: The specified transfer could not be found.

enumValues.name: UnknownWalletAddress
enumValues.description: The specified wallet address could not be found.

fields.name: success

fields.description: The date and time that the entity was created.

fields.description: Unique identifier for the entity.

fields.name: approveIncomingPayment
fields.description: Approves the incoming payment if the incoming payment is in the PENDING state

fields.name: cancelIncomingPayment
fields.description: Cancel the incoming payment if the incoming payment is in the PENDING state

fields.name: cancelOutgoingPayment
fields.description: Cancel an outgoing payment.

fields.name: createAsset
fields.description: Create a new asset.

fields.name: createAssetLiquidityWithdrawal
fields.description: Withdraw asset liquidity.

fields.description: Create an internal Open Payments incoming payment. The receiver has a wallet address on this Rafiki instance.

fields.name: createIncomingPaymentWithdrawal
fields.description: Withdraw incoming payment liquidity.

fields.name: createOrUpdatePeerByUrl
fields.description: Create or update a peer using a URL.

fields.name: createOutgoingPayment
fields.description: Create an Open Payments outgoing payment.

fields.name: createOutgoingPaymentFromIncomingPayment
fields.description: Create an Open Payments outgoing payment from an incoming payment.

fields.name: createOutgoingPaymentWithdrawal
fields.description: Withdraw outgoing payment liquidity.

fields.name: createPeer
fields.description: Create a new peer.

fields.name: createPeerLiquidityWithdrawal
fields.description: Withdraw peer liquidity.

fields.name: createQuote
fields.description: Create an Open Payments quote.

fields.name: createReceiver
fields.description: Create an internal or external Open Payments incoming payment. The receiver has a wallet address on either this or another Open Payments resource server.

fields.name: createWalletAddress
fields.description: Create a new wallet address.

fields.name: createWalletAddressKey
fields.description: Add a public key to a wallet address that is used to verify Open Payments requests.

fields.name: createWalletAddressWithdrawal
fields.description: Withdraw liquidity from a wallet address received via Web Monetization.

fields.name: deleteAsset
fields.description: Delete an asset.

fields.name: deletePeer
fields.description: Delete a peer.

fields.name: depositAssetLiquidity
fields.description: Deposit asset liquidity.

fields.name: depositEventLiquidity
fields.description: Deposit webhook event liquidity (deprecated).

fields.name: depositOutgoingPaymentLiquidity
fields.description: Deposit outgoing payment liquidity.

fields.name: depositPeerLiquidity
fields.description: Deposit peer liquidity.

fields.name: postLiquidityWithdrawal
fields.description: Post liquidity withdrawal. Withdrawals are two-phase commits and are committed via this mutation.

fields.name: revokeWalletAddressKey
fields.description: Revoke a public key associated with a wallet address. Open Payment requests using this key for request signatures will be denied going forward.

fields.name: setFee
fields.description: Set the fee structure on an asset.

fields.name: triggerWalletAddressEvents
fields.description: If automatic withdrawal of funds received via Web Monetization by the wallet address are disabled, this mutation can be used to trigger up to **n** withdrawal events.

fields.name: updateAsset
fields.description: Update an existing asset.

fields.name: updateIncomingPayment
fields.description: Update an existing incoming payment.

fields.name: updatePeer
fields.description: Update an existing peer.

fields.name: updateWalletAddress
fields.description: Update an existing wallet address.

fields.name: voidLiquidityWithdrawal
fields.description: Void liquidity withdrawal. Withdrawals are two-phase commits and are rolled back via this mutation.

fields.name: withdrawEventLiquidity
fields.description: Withdraw webhook event liquidity (deprecated).

types.name: UInt64

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
